description.narrative: The Projects are two green-field 6MWp grid-tied solar photovoltaic power plant located in Nakornratchasima and Loei, Thailand (the Projects) and developed as special purpose vehicles, Solar Power (Korat 2) Company Limited (SPKR2)) and Solar Power (Loei 1) Company Limited (SPLO1) (together the Companies), by Solar Power Company Limited (SPC or the Sponsor). The Project will be developed under Thailands Very Small Power Project (VSPP) program which supports independent generators smaller than 10MW to the Provincial Electricity Authority (PEA), one of two government owned distribution companies. The PPA term is indefinite with renewal every 5 years.

The Projects will have high development impact on the Thai solar market by supporting a small but professional Thai developer with the development of their further solar farm licenses creating a replicable model for the Sponsor and a demonstration effect for local and regional solar IPP developers. The Project will: a) promote private sector investment in the PV sector which is at an early stage of development in Thailand; b) support less carbon-intense economic development by substituting expansion of thermal power with zero-emission renewable energy and 4,785 CO2 tons avoided per year per project; and c) create direct and indirect employment opportunities in rural area of Thailand.

name.narrative: The SPKR2 Project site is situated in Don Chomphu sub-district of the Non Sung district located in the Nakhonratchasima province in Thailand. The total site area available for this Project is approximately 22 hectares and is suitable for a PV installation with high solar irradiation and easy access to transmission lines. The site has access to a main road. The SPLO1 Project site is situated in Nong Ya Plong sub-district of the Wang Saphung district located in the Loei province in Thailand. The total site area available for this Project is approximately 14.7 hectares and is suitable for a PV installation with high solar irradiation and easy access to transmission lines. The site has access to a main road.
